title: How to Draw an Acoustic Guitar

steps.title: Start off by drawing a horizontal egg shape for the body of your guitar.
steps.content: Start off by drawing a horizontal egg shape for the body of your guitar.

steps.title: Draw a long rectangle at the end of the egg shape for the fret board.
steps.content: Draw a long rectangle at the end of the egg shape for the fret board.

steps.title: At the start of the rectangle, inside the egg-shape, draw a circle.
steps.content: At the start of the rectangle, inside the egg-shape, draw a circle .

steps.title: Draw a small rectangle at the end of the fret board.
steps.content: Draw a small rectangle at the end of the fret board.

steps.title: Now add the thickness of the body.
steps.content: Now add the thickness of the body. This thickness will be determined by the shape you want the guitar. This tutorial will use the basic shape.

steps.title: Add the details like the strings, the fret divisions, and the tuning knobs.
steps.content: Add the details like the strings, the fret divisions, and the tuning knobs.

steps.title: Ink the drawing and erase the sketch.
steps.content: Ink the drawing and erase the sketch.

steps.title: Color the drawing and you are done!
steps.content: Color the drawing and you are done!

steps.title: Draw two ovals.
steps.content: Draw two ovals. The one on the left should be larger than the one on the right, like a lopsided snowman.

steps.title: Add two rectangles and one line to connect all the shapes.
steps.content: Add two rectangles and one line to connect all the shapes. The upper rectangle will serve as the neck of the guitar, and the line is the beginning of a string.

steps.title: Connect the ovals by adding two lines.
steps.content: Connect the ovals by adding two lines. Add small rectangles to give the guitar a boxier, more realistic shape.

steps.title: Draw a small circle inside of the smaller upper oval.
steps.content: Draw a small circle inside of the smaller upper oval. Add semicircles on the sides and tighten up your lines to make your guitar even more real-looking

steps.title: Draw two wavy lines to indicate the shape of the guitar.
steps.content: Draw two wavy lines to indicate the shape of the guitar. (At this point you should really begin to see it start looking like a musical instrument; if it doesn't, go back and make sure you haven't distorted anything.) Erase excess lines as seen.

steps.title: Draw six lines to render the strings of the guitar.
steps.content: Draw six lines to render the strings of the guitar. Draw other details like the tuning pegs and frets on the neck.

steps.title: Outline and color the drawing.
steps.content: Outline and color the drawing. Use shades of brown, unless your guitar is unusually colorful. Experiment with different shading and patterns to find out what looks the best.
